SQL> SELECT AVG(COUNT(co.officer_id))
  2  FROM officers o JOIN crime_officers co
  3  ON o.officer_id = co.officer_id
  4  GROUP BY o.officer_id;

AVG(COUNT(CO.OFFICER_ID))   2  FROM crimes
  3  GROUP BY status;

SQL> SELECT MAX(COUNT(cr.criminal_id))
  2  FROM criminals c JOIN crimes cr
  3  ON c.criminal_id = cr.criminal_id
  4  GROUP BY cr.criminal_id;

MAX(COUNT(CR.CRIMINAL_ID))   2  FROM crime_charges;

SQL> SELECT cr.criminal_id, cr.last, cr.first, COUNT(s.criminal_id) "SENTENCES"
  2  FROM criminals cr JOIN sentences s
  3  ON cr.criminal_id = s.criminal_id
  4  GROUP BY cr.criminal_id, cr.last, cr.first
  5  HAVING COUNT(s.criminal_id) > 1;

CRIMINAL_ID LAST            FIRST       SENTENCES                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                     

SQL> SELECT o.precinct, COUNT(cc.charge_status)
  2  FROM crime_officers co JOIN officers o
  3  ON co.officer_id = o.officer_id
  4  JOIN crime_charges cc
  5  ON co.crime_id = cc.crime_id
  6  WHERE cc.charge_status = 'GL'
  7  GROUP BY o.precinct
  8  HAVING COUNT(cc.charge_status)>= 7;

PREC COUNT(CC.CHARGE_STATUS)                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                            

SQL> SELECT c.classification, SUM(cc.fine_amount + cc.court_fee), SUM(cc.fine_amount + cc.court_fee - cc.amount_paid)
  2  FROM crimes c JOIN crime_charges cc
  3  ON c.crime_id = cc.crime_id
  4  GROUP BY c.classification;

C SUM(CC.FINE_AMOUNT+CC.COURT_FEE) SUM(CC.FINE_AMOUNT+CC.COURT_FEE-CC.AMOUNT_PAID)                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                   

SQL> SELECT c.classification, COUNT(c.classification), cc.charge_status, COUNT(cc.charge_status)
  2  FROM crimes c JOIN crime_charges cc
  3  ON c.crime_id = cc.crime_id
  4  GROUP BY GROUPING SETS((c.classification, cc.charge_status),());

C COUNT(C.CLASSIFICATION) CH COUNT(CC.CHARGE_STATUS)                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                            

SQL> SELECT c.classification, COUNT(c.classification), cc.charge_status, COUNT(cc.charge_status)
  2  FROM crimes c JOIN crime_charges cc
  3  ON c.crime_id = cc.crime_id
  4  GROUP BY ROLLUP(c.classification, cc.charge_status);

C COUNT(C.CLASSIFICATION) CH COUNT(CC.CHARGE_STATUS)                                          

7 rows selected.

SQL> SELECT c.classification, COUNT(c.classification), cc.charge_status, COUNT(cc.charge_status)
  2  FROM crimes c JOIN crime_charges cc
  3  ON c.crime_id = cc.crime_id
  4  GROUP BY (c.classification, cc.charge_status)
  5  UNION
  6  SELECT c.classification, COUNT(c.classification),NULL, COUNT(cc.charge_status)
  7  FROM crimes c JOIN crime_charges cc
  8  ON c.crime_id = cc.crime_id
  9  GROUP BY(c.classification, NULL);

C COUNT(C.CLASSIFICATION) CH COUNT(CC.CHARGE_STATUS)
